dataStructures

Class MinHeap

  • java.lang.Object
    • dataStructures.MinHeap

  • public class MinHeap
extends java.lang.Object
    MinHeap is a priority queue for Node objects. The capacity of the queue is predefined and cannot be altered. Nodes can be added to the queue and the smallest one is the first to be removed. Node sizes are defined and compared in the Node class and its subclasses.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MinHeap(int capacity)
      Creates a new MinHeap with the given capacity.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(Node node)
      Adds a Node into the heap.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if the heap is empty.
      Node poll()
      Removes and returns the smallest Node object in the heap.
